other_tests.findings: The pituitary adenoma resembled the motherâ€™s pituitary adenoma, with tumor cells arranged in trabeculae and glandular structures. It showed an elevated Ki-67 proliferation index of 8.5%.
Showed chromosome Xq26.3 microduplication in the fetus, confirming familial X-LAG.
Irregular mineralization of the vertebral bodies, trident acetabula, shortened long bones with irregular, dysplastic metaphyses, and short, dysplastic ribs with handlebar-appearing clavicles.
Showed a heterogeneously enhancing mass arising from the sella with suprasellar extension measuring 8.1 x 37.5 x 10.7 mm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 3.5 months of age, the mass increased to 9.0 x 30.0 x 12.0 mm; and at 10 months of age, it measured 12.5 x 12.5 x 15.1 mm.

other_tests.findings: Showed an area of hypointensity measuring 7.0 x 35.0 x 36.0 mm in the right side of the sella, suggestive of possible residual disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Compared with previous imaging, there was greater than 95% resection of the overall mass.
